title: Match of the Day: Alan Shearer 'lost' at what Graham Potter's Chelsea are trying to do
description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer says he is at a loss to explain what Graham Potter's Chelsea are trying to do in attack after a 1-0 loss to Southampton.

title: Andrew Lloyd Webber piece among new coronation music
description: The coronation service for King Charles will feature 12 newly-commissioned pieces of music.

title: The protesters who've gone missing as China deepens crackdown
description: Police have quietly gone after those who took part in the November protests that shook China.

title: Newcastle United's cutting edge missing as club prepares for EFL Cup final
description: Newcastle United's cutting edge has gone, for now at least, after dropping more points in the loss to Liverpool, says Phil McNulty.

title: Former US President Jimmy Carter to receive hospice care
description: The former US president will "spend his remaining time at home with his family", the Carter Center said.

title: Cesar Azpilicueta: Chelsea captain 'speaking' in hospital after head injury, says Graham Potter
description: Chelsea manager Graham Potter says captain Cesar Azpilicueta is "speaking" in hospital after suffering a head injury during Saturday's home defeat by Southampton.

title: Women's T20 World Cup: England 'building nicely' and 'can beat Australia'
description: England are "building nicely" towards the semi-finals of the Women's T20 World Cup, says captain Heather Knight.

title: Newcastle United 0-2 Liverpool: Reds end Newcastle run with clinical win
description: Liverpool's pursuit of a top-four Premier League finish gathers further momentum at the expense of Newcastle United's similar ambitions with a crucial win at St James' Park.

title: Coach passengers returning to UK face waits of more than six hours
description: Ferry operator P&O is advising passengers to use the toilet before arriving at the port of Calais.

title: Arsenal 'can achieve everything' after reigniting title hopes at Aston Villa - Oleksandr Zinchenko
description: Arsenal left it late but a stunning end to their win over Aston Villa shows why they are very much in the heat of the Premier League title race.

title: Asylum hotel disorder: Demonstrations held in Liverpool
description: Hundreds attend a rally in support of refugees after violence outside a hotel housing asylum seekers.

title: Nottingham Forest 1-1 Manchester City: Chris Wood denies City win
description: Manchester City miss the opportunity to return to the top of the Premier League as Chris Wood's late goal earns Nottingham Forest a point.

title: Chelsea 0-1 Southampton: James Ward-Prowse free-kick deepens gloom for Graham Potter
description: Chelsea's poor form under manager Graham Potter continues as James Ward-Prowse earns the Premier League's bottom club Southampton a surprise win at Stamford Bridge.

title: Celtic 4-0 Aberdeen: Leaders stay nine clear after dominant win
description: Celtic head into next weekend's Viaplay Cup final with their nine-point Scottish Premiership lead intact after Reo Hatate inspired a hammering of Aberdeen.

title: Ukraine war: Russia has committed crimes against humanity, US says
description: Kamala Harris said the US has "formally determined" that Russia has committed crimes against humanity.

title: Women's T20 World Cup: England beat India by 11 runs to stay top of group two
description: England beat India by 11 runs to keep their place at the top of group two and stay on track to avoid Australia in the semi-finals.

title: Turkey earthquake: Antakya now unrecognisable to tour guide
description: A 20-year tour guide takes the BBC into the Turkish city, where his usual reference points are in ruins.

title: New images of Mackenzie Crook's missing sister-in-law Laurel Aldridge
description: Laurel Aldridge, described as "very vulnerable", has gone missing from Arundel in West Sussex.

title: Nicola Sturgeon, Jeremy Corbyn, NI Protocol: A week that changed UK politics?
description: In three crucial ways, the landscape shifted - and the result could shape the next general election.

title: Iran International: Channel leaves UK after regime threats
description: Iran International says it's leaving the UK because of threats against its London-based journalists.

title: Aston Villa 2-4 Arsenal: Stoppage-time goals send Gunners top of Premier League
description: Arsenal score twice in stoppage time to win a six-goal thriller at Aston Villa and return to the top of the Premier League.

title: Comedian Rhod Gilbert shares cancer recovery goal
description: The Welshman says he' is "coming back" to his former self after treatment for head and neck cancer.

title: Women's T20 World Cup: Danni Wyatt out for golden duck to brilliant Richa Ghosh catch
description: Watch as India keeper Richa Ghosh produces a brilliant diving catch to remove England opener Danni Wyatt for a first-ball duck at the Women's T20 World Cup.

title: Manchester United sale: Sir Jim Ratcliffe and Ineos confirm bid
description: British billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe and his petrochemicals firm Ineos confirm their bid for Manchester United.

title: NI Protocol deal by no means done, says Rishi Sunak
description: The UK is preparing to announce it next week but the PM says there are "challenges to work through".

title: Banksy Margate Valentine's Day artwork to move to Dreamland
description: Dreamland says it "jumped at the chance" when it was asked to be the new home to the piece.

title: New Zealand v England: Stuart Broad goes from Nighthawk to Lord of the Night
description: Stuart Broad started the third day of the first Test as England's Nighthawk, but ended it with a spell that put them on course for victory over New Zealand.

title: Nicola Bulley search: Former police boss says criticism is unfair
description: A former police boss defends Lancashire Police's investigation into her disappearance.

title: N Korea fires missile after threatening retaliation
description: Pyongyang fires a missile into the sea a day after warning the US and Seoul against military drills.

title: Night without power for homes hit by Storm Otto
description: About 2,500 properties were still without supplies on Saturday morning following Friday's storm.

title: World Club Challenge: Penrith Panthers 12-13 St Helens
description: St Helens upset National Rugby League champions Penrith to become the first Super League side to win the World Club Challenge in Australia since 1994.

title: New Zealand v England: Stuart Broad magic spell puts tourists on course for victory
description: Stuart Broad's devastating late burst puts England on course for victory over New Zealand on day three of the first Test in Mount Maunganui.

title: Baftas: Journalist Christo Grozev banned over security risks
description: Christo Grozev helped to expose an alleged poisoning plot against Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny.

title: Tyson Fury v Anthony Joshua: Promoter Eddie Hearn still hopeful on fight this year.
description: Promoter Eddie Hearn says he has "not given up hope" on heavyweight Anthony Joshua fighting Tyson Fury later this year.

title: Christian Atsu found dead after Turkey earthquake - agent
description: Footballer Christian Atsu has been found dead under a collapsed building almost two weeks after the Turkey earthquake, his agent has confirmed.

title: Genesis Invitational: Rory McIlroy four behind leader Max Homa, Tiger Woods to make cut
description: Rory McIlroy is four shots off the lead at the Genesis Invitational, while Tiger Woods is set to make the cut.

title: Brexit: What can we expect from an NI Protocol deal?
description: With talk of an agreement as early as next week, what could the UK-EU compromise look like?

title: Rishi Sunak: We must double down on Ukraine military support
description: Allies must give advanced Nato capabilities and long term security assurances, Sunak will tell world leaders.

title: Treasure definition may be broadened to help museums
description: A surge in detectorists unearthing historical artefacts could prompt changes to the legal definition.

title: Tavistock children's gender clinic closure leaves uncertain future
description: The only NHS gender clinic for children in England and Wales will close this spring - but what's next?

title: Mississippi mass shooting: Six killed and suspect detained, police say
description: Police found six victims dead in five separate places in rural Mississippi, investigators say.

title: Why is the UK economy lagging behind the US, Germany and others?
description: Projections suggest the UK recovering slower than other countries - and the reasons go beyond Brexit.

title: Serbia nationalist protests spike tensions over Russia
description: Death threats were made against President Vucic who denounced the protesters as "anti-Serbian".

title: Shape-shifting robot melts itself to escape lab jail
description: Within minutes, the Lego-like figure is seen moving behind bars, then liquefying itself to freedom.

title: Week in pictures: 11-17 February 2023
description: A selection of powerful images from around the world, taken in the past seven days.

title: Why TikTok sleuths descended on Nicola Bulley’s village
description: Marianna Spring goes to visits St Michael's on Wyre to try to understand the scale of the social media frenzy.

title: In Canada, complex fraud schemes are targeting homeowners
description: In Toronto's red hot real estate market, homes are reportedly being sold out from under their owners.
